
When the parent document becomes composited, the layer trees should get connected together.

{
  "layers": [
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "bounds": [800, 600],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutIFrame IFRAME id='iframe'",
      "position": [9, 109],
      "bounds": [368, 218],
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Frame Overflow Controls Host Layer",
      "position": [43, 143],
      "bounds": [300, 150]
    },
    {
      "name": "Frame Clipping Layer",
      "position": [43, 143],
      "bounds": [285, 150]
    },
    {
      "name": "Frame Scrolling Layer",
      "position": [43, 143]
    },
    {
      "name": "Content Root Layer",
      "position": [43, 143],
      "bounds": [285, 230]
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "position": [43, 143],
      "bounds": [285, 230],
      "drawsContent": true,
      "backgroundColor": "#C0C0C0"
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutBlockFlow DIV id='iframe-content' class='box'",
      "position": [61, 153],
      "bounds": [210, 210],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true,
      "backgroundColor": "#0000FF"
    },
    {
      "name": "Frame Vertical Scrollbar Layer",
      "position": [328, 143],
      "bounds": [15, 150]
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutBlockFlow DIV id='box' class='composited'",
      "position": [8, 8],
      "bounds": [100, 100],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true,
      "backgroundColor": "#0000FF"
    }
  ]
}
